newsitem.title: GERMANY: Russia makes another debt-restructuring payment.
newsitem.headline: Russia makes another debt-restructuring payment.

text.p: Germany's Deutsche Bank AG said on Friday that Russia's Vnesheconombank has transferred 95 million dollars to a trust account with the Bank of England as part of a restructuring of Russian debt.

Deutsche, which chairs the talks, said the payment was the ninth instalment of the cash downpayment in accordance with a deal reached to restructure some of the external debt of the former Soviet Union that was reached in November 1995.
The payments by Vnesheconombank since February 1995 now total 1.57 billion dollars, Deutsche said in a statement.
Russia also agreed to pay $1.5 billion by the end of 1996 for interest arrears falling due in 1994 and 1995.

Russia and its creditor banks had reached the agreement last November to reschedule the repayment of $25.5 billion in principal over a 25-year period and $7 billion in interest arrears over 20 years, both with a seven-year grace period.
